title: Understanding New York State Mathematics Standards Through Real-world Applications
driving_question: How can we apply the New York State P-12 Learning Standards for Mathematics to solve real-world problems?
short_background_context: In 2013, New York State began administering tests designed to assess student performance in accordance with the instructional shifts and rigor demanded by the new New York State P-12 Learning Standards in Mathematics. These standards are used to create multiple-choice, short-response, and extended-response questions that measure a student's understanding of mathematical procedures, concepts, and applications. Many of these questions are framed within the context of real-world applications or require students to complete multiple steps, drawing on the simultaneous application of multiple skills and concepts.
tasks: Analyze and solve a set of multiple-choice questions designed to assess standard algorithms and conceptual standards.
Complete a series of short-response questions that require the application of multiple mathematics skills and real-world applications.
Respond to extended-response questions that assess your understanding of mathematical procedures, conceptual understanding, and application.
pre_thinking_prompts: What real-world situations can you think of that might require the use of these mathematical concepts?
What strategies will you use to solve multi-step problems?
How might you apply different mathematical skills simultaneously to solve a problem?
reflection_prompt: Reflect on your understanding of the New York State P-12 Learning Standards for Mathematics. How confident do you feel in applying these standards to solve real-world problems? What areas do you think you need to improve?
ai_tutor_prompts: How did you decide which mathematical concepts to apply to solve this problem?
What strategies did you use to solve this multi-step problem?
Can you explain why you chose this approach to solve the problem?
remix_zone: Students can remix this problem by creating their own real-world problems that require the application of the New York State P-12 Learning Standards for Mathematics. They can also try solving the problems using different mathematical concepts and strategies.
